abid.title: AbID size category for Firestone flat files

comments.body: @doncat This is rare books so I realize it's unlikely, but there's no case where I have two items of the same holding? Would the goal there be that both barcodes get the same AbID?

To start with, "rare books" is a meaningless phrase.  SC collections aren't different from anything else.  (I have statistical demonstration of this fact!)
Yes, it's entirely possible to have two items for the same holding.  Such a case is included in the sample records in the related document. 
Oh, and can someone add "Set 852 1st indicator to '8'" in the preceding?  I forgot that change.  "8" means local.

lib_jobs.title: Job to move invoice status files and fund adjustment files

comments.body:
Invoice status:
  the files for input will be:  /mnt/dms-smbserve/peoplesoft/voucher_status/
  push to lib-sftp in the invoice_status directory

Fund Adjustment:
  Just move the file between  /mnt/dms-smbserve/peoplesoft/fund_adjustment/ to lib-sftp in fund_adjustment  File will be .csv

Here is the example code @mzelesky created and tested.
```
require 'nokogiri'
​
def invoices_from_status_query(doc)
  invoices = {}
  doc.xpath('//row').each do |row|
    invoice_id = row.at_xpath('INVOICE_ID').text
    payment_status = row.at_xpath('PYMNT_SELCT_STATUS').text
    payment_status ||= ''
    payment_status.upcase!
    payment_status = 'REJECTED' unless payment_status == 'PAID'
    invoice_date = row.at_xpath('INVOICE_DATE').text
    payment_date = row.at_xpath('PAYMENT_VOUCHER_DATE').text
    voucher_id = row.at_xpath('VOUCHER_ID').text
    payment_amount = row.at_xpath('PYMNT_AMT').text
    currency = row.at_xpath('CURRENCY_PYMNT').text
    message = row.at_xpath('PYMNT_MESSAGE').text
    invoices[invoice_id] = {}
    invoices[invoice_id][:payment_status] = payment_status
    invoices[invoice_id][:invoice_date] = invoice_date
    invoices[invoice_id][:payment_date] = payment_date
    invoices[invoice_id][:voucher_id] = voucher_id
    invoices[invoice_id][:currency] = currency
    invoices[invoice_id][:payment_amount] = payment_amount
    invoices[invoice_id][:message] = message
  end
  invoices
end
​
def invoices_to_alma_xml(invoices)
  builder = Nokogiri::XML::Builder.new(encoding: 'UTF-8') do |xml|
    xml['xb'].payment_confirmation_data('xmlns:xb' => 'http://com/exlibris/repository/acq/xmlbeans') {
      xml['xb'].invoice_list {
        invoices.each do |invoice_id, info|
          xml['xb'].invoice {
            xml['xb'].unique_identifier invoice_id
            xml['xb'].payment_status info[:payment_status]
            xml['xb'].invoice_date info[:invoice_date]
            xml['xb'].payment_voucher_date info[:payment_date]
            xml['xb'].payment_voucher_number info[:voucher_id]
            xml['xb'].payment_note info[:message]
            xml['xb'].voucher_amount {
              xml['xb'].currency info[:currency]
              xml['xb'].sum info[:payment_amount]
            }
          }
        end
      }
    }
  end
  builder.to_xml
end
​
doc = File.open('/Users/mzelesky/Downloads/PU_AP_ALMA_INVOICE_DETAILS_06142021.xml') { |f| Nokogiri::XML(f) }
invoices = invoices_from_status_query(doc)
output_doc = invoices_to_alma_xml(invoices)
File.open('./../output/alma_status_query_output.xml', 'w') do |output|
  output.puts(output_doc)
end
```

orangelight.title: Handle possible 429 from bibdata patron endpoint

comments.body: This should be resolved with #2503

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/40598223/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/40598223)

Coverage remained the same at 96.771% when pulling **5b8fab2908496abe9aeb88ee5b887bdfb4aceafd on fix-cap** into **5165e5f6bce8974b747aba3656b3af5aed0ad536 on alma**.

- The files system was read only https://gist.github.com/tpendragon/106bdbb23c42c5bd53b6cb27f0de0ab0#file-stderr-L19.
- Restarted the vm
- deployed with cap -> error because of old node version, nodejs was still 8
- ran playbook to update nodejs in lib-orange-qa1
- deployed with cap -> schema migration error
- Because of the postgres staging migration there was a shema migration error
- dropped the database as we did in https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1394
- deployed with cap -> cannot find the orangelight-qa database
- ran the playbook again
- Deployed successfully
- There is still a `500 Internal Server Error` when loading https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/ 
- the index catalog-qa had been deleted from solr8-staging. Updated it to point to catalog-staging. 
I will open a ticket to add a catalog-qa index in lib-solr8 staging https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/issues/276
this is fixed

I'm wondering about an alternative plan here:

What if we made another set of browse list tables, for alma? If OL is configured to use Alma it uses those, otherwise it uses the old ones. Then we just point at the normal production OL database.

@tpendragon my thought was to create new browse lists tables to close this issue https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1362. Now that we have a separate alma branch I dont think there is a problem to have the cron jobs running on the new pul indexer boxes https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/af08d2c343e81c7be89c5ac91d65f5305bce72db/config/schedule.rb.

The migration should be considered for other tables. For example for bookmarks.
Will doubling the browse lists be a database size issue? Look on postgres and see how big the tables are.

WIP: Work on sorting out bibdata samba clients from servers

comments.body: @kayiwa and I tried a different direction on #2313 for which which we have a sligtht preference.

And the description on this PR is incorrect. After reviewing the samba role more carefully, those configs are for setting up a share on the server-side, as @carolyncole had initially said.

Since we don't want to do both, and hr_share is working, #2313 removes the bibdata samba_server tasks in favor of the samba role configs, and resolves the directory permissions issues we were previously seeing.
